page.title: 16WILDLIFE IN OUR SCHOOL
page.content: In the school grounds there are a lot of different flowers. In a short while we found these varieties: Yarrow, Daisy, Buttercup, Thistle, Cornflower, Cow Parsley, Clover, Groundsel, Vetch, Red Campion, Dog Rose, Early Purple Orchid, Plantain, Honeysuckle, Dandelion, Kingcup, Woody Nightshade, Great Willowherb, Rosebay Willowherb, and Horseshoe Vetch. The most common colour in the flowers is yellow. In the pond we spotted Bullrushes, Lilies, Duckweed, tadpoles, water- skaters and watersnails, and there are signs of many small mammals in the hedgerows. We see a variety of birds in the area, but the most common bird in the trees around the field is the thrush.
